title: List of Redbeard albums
text:
<a href="Redbeard%20%28comics%29">Redbeard</a> is a series of <a href="Belgium">Belgian</a> <a href="comic%20books">comic books</a>, originally published in <a href="French%20language">French</a>, created by writer <a href="Jean-Michel%20Charlier">Jean-Michel Charlier</a> and artist <a href="Victor%20Hubinon">Victor Hubinon</a>. After their deaths the series was continued by other writers and artists, including <a href="Jij%C3%A9">Jijé</a> (Joseph Gillain), Christian Gaty, Patrice Pellerin, Jean Ollivier, Christian Perrissin and Marc Bourgne.
The albums have been published in <a href="France">France</a>, <a href="Finland">Finland</a>, <a href="Belgium">Belgium</a>, The <a href="Netherlands">Netherlands</a>, <a href="Germany">Germany</a>, <a href="Denmark">Denmark</a>, former <a href="Yugoslavia">Yugoslavia</a> (in the Serbo-Croatian language) and <a href="Croatia">Croatia</a>.
This list gives the published albums in chronological order. The years are from their first publication in French.
Spinoff series.
Since 1996 there is also a spin-off series, called "The Young Years Of Readbeard", created by different authors than the main series: the scenario is by Christian Perrissin and the artist is Daniel Redondo.
These stories deal with Redbeard's youth before he was a pirate and how he decided to become one. His name is given as Jean-Baptiste Cornic, a servant of the French king. Also explained is how he lost his eye.
